story-details.story-title: Implement Foundational Authenticated Main View Layout

user-story.i-want: to see the basic layout of my private profile view at `/[username]`, including placeholders for my bio, todo list, and the three habit columns ("Today", "Yesterday", and "The Pile")
user-story.so-that: I have a clear structure for where my habits and todos will appear.

acceptance-criteria.ac: The `app/[username]/page.tsx` renders the basic layout for an authenticated user.
The layout includes a placeholder for the user's bio.
The layout includes a placeholder for the todo list ("Actions" Section).
The layout includes three distinct column placeholders for habits: "Today", "Yesterday", and "The Pile".
The layout is responsive, adapting to desktop (two-row) and mobile (single-column, stacked) views as described in UX Design Specification.

subtask.title: Create `app/[username]/layout.tsx` to wrap the `page.tsx` with user-specific layout.
Define a root container for the main view.
Add a placeholder for the user's bio (e.g., a `div` or component with a descriptive comment).
Add a placeholder for the 'Actions' section (Todos).
Add a container for the three habit columns ('Today', 'Yesterday', 'The Pile').
Implement basic CSS for the three habit columns to demonstrate desktop (two-row) and mobile (stacked) layouts using Tailwind CSS.

task.title: Integrate `AppHeader` into `app/[username]/layout.tsx` (or parent layout if appropriate)

subtask.title: Ensure the `AppHeader` (created in Story 1.4) is correctly displayed at the top of the authenticated view. (This might involve adjusting `app/layout.tsx` if `app/[username]/layout.tsx` takes over more responsibility).
Utilize `shadcn/ui` components for basic structural elements where appropriate (e.g., `Card` for column containers).
Write a test to ensure the bio placeholder is rendered.
Write a test to ensure the todo list placeholder is rendered.
Write tests to ensure the three habit column placeholders are rendered.
(Optional) Write a basic test to verify responsive layout classes (e.g., flex directions or grid setups).
